hero.title: Empowering African Girls to Lead the Future of STEM
hero.description: At She STEMin Africa, we're working to realize this vision so that, through our association, more women become involved in the STEM fields described below. But more than that, we want to provide these women with all the support they may need to blossom both academically and professionally.

biology.name: Biology
biology.title: BIOLOGY
biology.description: or the study of living things, explores the different forms of life on our planet. It is a science that examines organisms, their structure, function and evolution.
details: Microbiology - Ecology - Genetics - Physiology are all part of biology.
Biologists can research new diseases to find innovative treatments, study ecosystems to help preserve biodiversity, work in the agri-food industry to improve yields and develop new crop varieties.
biology.careers: Career opportunities include medical research, environmental conservation, agriculture, biochemistry, biotechnology and teaching.

chemistry.name: Chemistry
chemistry.title: CHEMISTRY
chemistry.description: Chemistry is the science that studies matter and the changes it undergoes. It explores the composition, structure, properties and behavior of atoms and molecules.
details: Organic chemistry, inorganic chemistry, physical chemistry, and analytical chemistry are major branches.
Chemists develop new materials, medicines, fuels, and technologies that improve our daily lives.
chemistry.careers: Career opportunities include pharmaceutical research, materials science, environmental chemistry, forensics, and chemical engineering.

physics.name: Physics
physics.title: PHYSICS
physics.description: Physics is the fundamental science that seeks to understand how the universe works, from the smallest particles to the largest structures in space.
details: Quantum physics, thermodynamics, electromagnetism, and mechanics are core areas.
Physicists develop technologies like lasers, computers, medical imaging, and renewable energy systems.
physics.careers: Career opportunities include research, engineering, astronomy, medical physics, and technology development.

geology.name: Geology
geology.title: GEOLOGY
geology.description: Geology is the science that studies the Earth, its materials, processes, and history. It helps us understand our planet's past and predict its future.
details: Mineralogy, petrology, stratigraphy, and geophysics are key specializations.
Geologists study natural disasters, find natural resources, and help protect the environment.
geology.careers: Career opportunities include environmental consulting, mining, oil and gas exploration, and natural disaster prediction.

computerScience.name: Computer Science
computerScience.title: COMPUTER SCIENCE
computerScience.description: Computer Science is the study of computational systems and the design of computer systems and their applications.
details: Programming, algorithms, artificial intelligence, and cybersecurity are major areas.
Computer scientists develop software, apps, AI systems, and secure digital infrastructure.
computerScience.careers: Career opportunities include software development, data science, cybersecurity, AI research, and tech entrepreneurship.

mathematics.name: Mathematics
mathematics.title: MATHEMATICS
mathematics.description: Mathematics is the abstract science of number, quantity, and space, either as abstract concepts or as applied to other disciplines.
details: Pure mathematics, applied mathematics, statistics, and mathematical modeling are key areas.
Mathematicians solve complex problems in science, technology, finance, and many other fields.
mathematics.careers: Career opportunities include data analysis, financial modeling, research, education, and cryptography.

founder.title: « She STEMin Africa » project is the initiative of Dr. Pulchérie Matsodoum Nguemté.
founder.bio1: Pulcherie comes from the western region of Cameroon (« Bamiléké »), and is the 3rd of 5 children, mainly girls. Among her siblings, she is by far the least intelligent (or so she has always convinced herself), due to her poor academic prowess in high school. But, she quickly realized her abilities when she determined to achieve her goals. In fact, she is persevering and has always been described as a strong woman. She ended up passing all her classes to the point of becoming the first (men and women combined) to hold a PhD degree in her entire extended family.
founder.bio2: Dr. Matsodoum studied in Cameroon and obtained a Master's degree in Plant Biotechnology. After being selected for a doctorate, her thesis topic, which dealt with the clean-up of hydrocarbon-polluted soils, was funded by the Schlumberber Foundation (Faculty For The Future). This grant is awarded to women from developing countries enrolled in doctoral or post-doctoral studies. Dr. Matsodoum pursued her thesis work in partnership with the University of Yaoundé I in Cameroon and the University of Strasbourg in France and defended her doctoral thesis in Biotechnologies and Environment on May 20, 2019. This day is a celebration day in her country and will remain memorable for her, especially as it marks Cameroon's independence.
